summary: The document is a confidential memorandum from November 6, 1963, detailing the JMHART project within the AMWORLD initiative. It focuses on strategies to engage ex-President Figueres and Foreign Minister Cduber to enhance the project's appeal to the moderate left by utilizing their influence. Additionally, it considers the role of President Betancourt in supporting the MRR (Movimiento Revolucionario del Pueblo) and examines the impact of key individuals and publications on Latin American political thought to further the project's goals.
key_findings: The CIA contemplates employing contract personnel, especially those linked to the Panamerican Foundation, to facilitate connections with ex-President Figueres and Foreign Minister Cduber.
Plans involve incorporating Artime's MRR and similar groups into an educational initiative aimed at fostering democratic values and securing moderate left support.
The memorandum proposes using President Betancourt's stature to enhance the MRR's legitimacy, avoiding his direct participation in operations.

It underscores the significance of certain figures and a periodical in influencing the moderate left's ideology in Latin America, pointing to the critical role of political and ideological partnerships.
